about.description:
ngspice is the open source spice simulator for electric and electronic circuits.

Such a circuit may comprise of JFETs, bipolar and MOS transistors, passive elements
like R, L, or C, diodes, transmission lines and other devices, all interconnected
in a netlist. Digital circuits are simulated as well, event driven and fast, from
single gates to complex circuits. And you may enter the combination of both analog
and digital as a mixed-signal circuit.

ngspice offers a wealth of device models for active, passive, analog, and digital
elements. Model parameters are provided by the semiconductor manufacturers.
The user add her circuits as a netlist, and the output is one or more graphs of
currents, voltages and other electrical quantities or is saved in a data file.

Note:
  This build was configured with `--enable-xspice --enable-cider --enable=openmp`
  See the [build script](https://git.io/JfVZX) for more specifics.
about.summary: The open source spice simulator for electric and electronic circuits

name: ngspice
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.7
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: ngspice
  version: '36'
source:
  patches: null
  sha256: 4f818287efba245341046635b757ae81f879549b326a4316b5f6e697aa517f8c
  url: https://downloads.sourceforge.net/project/ngspice/ng-spice-rework/36/ngspice-36.tar.gz
build:
  noarch: false
  noarch_python: false
  number: '7'
  string: ha770c72_7
requirements:
  build: []
  run:
    - ngspice-exe 36 hf248978_7
    - ngspice-lib 36 hf248978_7
test:
  commands:
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libngspice.so
    - $PREFIX/bin/ngspice --version
about:
  description: "ngspice is the open source spice simulator for electric and electronic\
    \ circuits.\n\nSuch a circuit may comprise of JFETs, bipolar and MOS transistors,\
    \ passive elements\nlike R, L, or C, diodes, transmission lines and other devices,\
    \ all interconnected\nin a netlist. Digital circuits are simulated as well, event\
    \ driven and fast, from\nsingle gates to complex circuits. And you may enter the\
    \ combination of both analog\nand digital as a mixed-signal circuit.\n\nngspice\
    \ offers a wealth of device models for active, passive, analog, and digital\n\
    elements. Model parameters are provided by the semiconductor manufacturers.\n\
    The user add her circuits as a netlist, and the output is one or more graphs of\n\
    currents, voltages and other electrical quantities or is saved in a data file.\n\
    \nNote:\n  This build was configured with `--enable-xspice --enable-cider --enable=openmp`\n\
    \  See the [build script](https://git.io/JfVZX) for more specifics.\n"
  dev_url: http://ngspice.sourceforge.net/devel.html
  doc_url: http://ngspice.sourceforge.net/docs.html
  home: http://ngspice.sourceforge.net
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: The open source spice simulator for electric and electronic circuits
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - stuarteberg
